intro: Synallodia japonica, commonly known as the Japanese synallodia, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. It is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent.
